subject: Economics
title: Hyperbolic Discounting: Why $100 Now Beats $110 Tomorrow
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Hyperbolic Discounting: Why $100 Now Beats $110 Tomorrow.

hook.text: Offer someone $100 today or $110 tomorrow ‚Äî most take the $100. Offer $100 in 30 days or $110 in 31 ‚Äî most wait.

buildup.text: Standard economics assumes people discount the future at a constant rate.

discovery.text: Hyperbolic discounting: we overvalue immediate rewards and undervalue future ones, but only when 'now' is involved.

twist.text: This is why people take payday loans at 400% interest. The pain is future; the relief is now. The math doesn't matter.

climax.text: Our brains run on two systems: one wants marshmallows now, the other plans for retirement. They rarely agree.

punchline.text: We're perfectly rational about the future and perfectly impatient about today.

quiz.question: What is hyperbolic discounting?
options: Preferring guaranteed money over risky bets
Disproportionately preferring immediate rewards over slightly larger future ones
